title: Sri Lanka axes Norway, Iraq embassies, Sydney consulate over currency crisis
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is closing embassies in Norway, Iraq and a consulate in Sydney the foreign ministry from April 30, the Foreign Ministry said as a currency crisis deepened.

“It is part of a general restructuring of Sri Lanka’s diplomatic representation overseas, undertaken by the Foreign Ministry in the context of the current economic situation and foreign currency constraints faced by the country,” the Foreign Ministry said.
“The decision with regard to the temporary closure of the two Missions and Post was taken by the Government of Sri Lanka following careful deliberation.”
The Ambassador of Sri Lanka in Stockholm, Sweden will be accredited to Norway, and the Ambassador of Sri Lanka in Abu Dhabi, will be accredited to Iraq.
The consular jurisdiction of the Consulate General in Sydney will revert to the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Canberra, Australia.
